id: bigtech:x is launching a marketplace for inactive handles:2025-10-19T20:44:40.000Z
title: X is launching a marketplace for inactive handles
author: Terrence O’Brien
summary_long: Premium Plus and Premium Business users will soon be able to browse and request inactive usernames on the X Handle Marketplace. Handles are going to be broken up into two broad categories. If you secure a new handle, your old one will be frozen. The company says it may eventually offer a redirect option as a paid add-on. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2025-10-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:the next game in the halo franchise could be live service mu:2025-10-19T17:10:36.000Z
title: The next game in the Halo franchise could be live service multiplayer
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: Nearly four years after the release of Halo: Infinite, the sixth installment in the franchise has failed to live up to its name. Instead, the studio behind the sci-fi series may be working on a "live service, long-term updating multiplayer" Halo game that could do just that. According to YouTuber Rebs Gaming, a source claimed that Halo Studios, previously known as 343 Industries, is working on a multiplayer Halo title that could borrow Fortnite's model of constantly pushing out content updates. The report also noted that there aren't any mentions of Fortnite's battle royale style for the upcoming game. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-10-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:something from space may have just struck a united airlines :2025-10-19T18:50:10.000Z
title: Something from “space” may have just struck a United Airlines flight over Utah
author: Eric Berger
summary_long: The National Transportation Safety Board confirmed Sunday that it is investigating an airliner that was struck by an object in its windscreen, mid-flight, over Utah. “NTSB gathering radar, weather, flight recorder data,” the federal agency said on the social media site X. “Windscreen being sent to NTSB laboratories for examination.” The strike occurred Thursday, during a United Airlines flight from Denver to Los Angeles. Images shared on social media showed that one of the two large windows at the front of a 737 MAX aircraft was significantly cracked. Source: arstechnica.com. Date: 2025-10-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:organizers say over 7 million showed up to no kings protests:2025-10-19T14:50:06.000Z
title: Organizers say over 7 million showed up to No Kings protests
author: Terrence O’Brien
summary_long: Saturday marked the biggest day of protest since the start of Donald Trumps’ second term. Organizers of the No Kings protests estimated that over seven million people took to the streets to declare their opposition to the president, his policies, and his tactics. Indivisible, the group behind the protests, claims that there were over 2,700 events in all 50 states. That’s a sizable increase from the roughly five million protesters at 2,000 events it claimed for its June No Kings day, signalling that opposition to the president may be growing. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2025-10-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:x is testing a new way of opening links in posts to improve :2025-10-19T21:12:10.000Z
title: X is testing a new way of opening links in posts to improve engagement
summary_long: Links have proven to be a tricky thing when it comes to social media engagement. On platforms like Threads, data suggests that people often don't click the links in posts, and creators on X have complained that posts including links don't get as much visibility. X is now trying to solve that. Head of product Nikita Bier shared that the platform is "testing a new link experience" that lets people open a link without leaving the original post entirely, so they can still view the Like, Repost and other buttons. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-10-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:china claims the nsa conducted cyberattacks on its national :2025-10-19T20:18:52.000Z
title: China claims the NSA conducted cyberattacks on its national time center
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: As political tensions between the two global superpowers grow, China's State Security Ministry accused the US' National Security Agency of a cyberattack operation that took place between 2023 and 2024. As first reported by Reuters, the Chinese agency posted on WeChat that the NSA targeted the country's National Time Service Center. As part of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the center is tasked with generating, maintaining and transmitting its national standard of time, which is provided to important sectors across the country, including communications, defense and finance. The state ministry said the operation used around 42 types of "special cyberattack weapons" to infiltrate the National Time Service Center which could have led to the disruption of network communications, financial systems and power supply. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-10-19. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.
